title: Ruth Farmer. A story
author: Marchbank, Agnes.
snippet: In Lauriston there are three streets in the form ofa triangle. One side of this triangle is calledGraham Street, another Keir Street. The houses thereare like most of the Lauriston houses—roomy andlarge and well-built.

title: My college days,
author: Tomes, Robert
snippet: and turbulence of his domestic establishment, I was soon comfortably domiciled in snug quarters  in the lodgings in Graham Street, kept by a buxom, canny Scotchwoman, of the name of Munro. Next door to us lived a very old gentleman  — a Mr. Ainslie.

title: Ruth Farmer. A story
author: Marchbank, Agnes.
snippet: The place is lively enough then. Keir Street hasan advantage over Graham Street, inasmuch thatthe houses on the north side have from their backwindows one of the finest views to be had in thecity; for they stand high above the Grassmarket,and a view can be obtained embracing Queensferryand the coast to near Portobello, as well as theFife hills. The Castle rock towers up before them,and the "ridge" on which, "piled deep and massy,"
